text: <@U04BE0ELZ> thanks!
<@U043AB2QT>: <@U03V8V08M> are you two using ember-concurrency with regularity now? I've read up on it but haven't actually taken the first step into using it
<@U04BD6KB1> yes
it has turned confusion into clarity every place I’ve seen it used
<@U04BD6KB1> Yep. It's like when you first started using promises. Everything seems better with an ec task and you ask yourself "How did we ever build stuff without it?"
(this comes with the usual caveats)
Cool. Good motivation for me to get with the program.
promises are a very good analogy
<@U326W6T5J|michal.szewczak> has joined the channel
yep, e-c is sweeeet
so much that I decided to use it in ember-power-select and ember-power-calendar
I has hesitant because I was bringing a non-despicable amount of code to people's project
but the benefits worth the price by far
and within months I bet that 75% of apps will be using it anyway
who's sending proposars for emberconf here?
<@U03V8V08M> you being in the comitee means you can't send proposals?
<@U040MK408>: I can but I can't see my own
if the proposals get rejected I might give a talk in Austria with my rejected ideas still
<@U3281D18V|renitapinto> has joined the channel
how are things going with integration testing in ember land these days?
I would like to update my test recorder one day.
still the same setup with qunit?

Hi everyone,
I have upgraded ember from 2.3.0 to 2.9.1 and QUnit to 2.0.0. I get the following error while running the tests, 
'Uncaught Error: QUnit.start cannot be called inside a test context.This feature is removed in QUnit 2.0. For async tests, use QUnit.test() with assert.async() instead.'
Source: <https://localhost:7357/assets/test-support.js:2711>
Looks like QUnit.start() is called inside dist/assets/test-support.js.  Has anyone come accross this before?
what version of JQuery have you got installed?
When JQuery 3 came out, they changed the semantics of `$(document).ready()`
which caused a problem, which is fixed in ember-cli-qunit 2.2.2 and 3.0.1
see <https://github.com/ember-cli/ember-cli/issues/6247>

attachments.title: Test failure in browser on clean ember-cli 2.8.0 install · Issue #6247 · ember-cli/ember-cli · GitHub
attachments.text: With a fresh app generated with ember new with ember-cli 2.8.0, tests run in the browser (<http://localhost:4200>) have a failure. (When running the tests via ember test or ember test --serve, the fa...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Test failure in browser on clean ember-cli 2.8.0 install · Issue #6247 · ember-cli/ember-cli

text: Thanks <@U06BGNMBL>.  I found the solution. It was to do with the Ember-cli-blanket.  I fixed the problem by setting autostart to false in blanket-options.js
cool
wonder if they're having the same issue then?
<@U32E552SF|tuzz> has joined the channel
